title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.48 | 20-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjani Shalakaya
Chaksharunmeelitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamennati Namine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Sri Advaita Gadadhara Srivasadi Gauravaktavrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Nama Skritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udy Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 48th verse
of the 9th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
We will come on and on.
almost to the end of this chapter describing the passing away of Bhishma Deva in the presence
of Lord Krishna, tato yudhishthira gatva sahakrishno gajafayam pitaram santvayam asa gandhareemcha
tapasvinim.
The meaning of this verse is thereafter Maharaj Yudhishthira at once went to his capital Hastinapura
accompanied by Lord Shri Krishna and there he consoled his uncle and aunt Gandhari, uncle
Dhritarashtra and aunt Gandhari who was an ascetic, Gandhareemcha tapasvinim, tapasvi
she was an ascetic.
So Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport, Dhritarashtra and Gandhari the father and
the mother of Duryodhana and his brothers were the elder uncle and aunt of Maharaj
Yudhishthira.
After the battle of Kurukshetra the celebrated couple having lost all their sons and grandsons
were under the care of Maharaj Yudhishthira.
What happened in the battle of Kurukshetra all the 100 sons of Dhritarashtra and Gandhari
they were killed in the battle and even the grandsons.
Everyone was killed from Dhritarashtra's side Kaurava side.
Dhritarashtra was very very confident that his sons will win the battle because they
had the best support, but Dhritarashtra being materialistic he made a miscalculation, he
did not stop the war.
Water.
So, consider Krishna, even though he was not fighting, actually, he had not taken up any weapons in the battle, he was on the side of the Pandavas.
Yes, Jayastu Pandu Putranam, Esham Pakshe Janardana, whosoever side Krishna is, that side ultimately is going to win.
Even Sanjaya, at the end of the Bhagavad Gita, while narrating what is happening on the battlefield of Kurukshetra, before the battle is about to begin, Sanjaya says,
at the end of the Bhagavad Gita, 45 minutes, that's all, Krishna spoke Bhagavad Gita to Arjuna.
So, Sanjaya concludes,
Yatra Yogeshwara Krishna, Yatra Partho Dhanurdhara, Tatra Shri Vijayo, Bhutir Dhruva, Neetir Matir Mama.
Wherever there is Krishna and wherever there is Arjuna, his pure devotee, there, there is certainly victory.
So, even before the battle began, Sanjaya predicted and announced to Dhritarashtra that don't expect victory for the Kauravas because Krishna and Arjuna, Krishna and his pure devotee,
of course, all the Pandavas are pure devotees, but still, wherever there is Krishna and Arjuna, there, there is victory.
Pandavas.
Pandavas are guaranteed to win.
So, all of the material calculations, ultimately, are a failure.
Everything actually happens even in the material world, according to the plan of the Supreme Lord, according to the will of Govinda.
That's how everything actually is happening, is going on.
Though Krishna never takes away the free will of the living entities, he never takes away the free will, but the living entities are very, very, very, very, very tiny.
They are insignificant parts of the Supreme Lord, who is unlimitedly powerful.
And we have some power, some strength, some knowledge, some ability.
We are very, very, very, very, very, very tiny, insignificant, atomic, we are atomic, and Krishna is the complete whole, the total manifestation of the material, spiritual, everything.
So, there is no comparison.
It is foolish to think that...
To think that, I can become God, I can compete with God, Krishna.
That is utterly foolish, utterly foolish.
So, therefore, only devotees have this sense that, what am I in comparison to Krishna?
So, our devotees' humility is very...
Reasonable and natural, and it is very meaningful, to take a humble position in presence of Krishna, and always remain so, because eternally that is our position.
So, here the explanation is being given that, what is the situation of Dhritarashtra and Gandhari after the battle of Kurukshetra?
They lost all...
All their sons and grandsons.
So, they were passing their days in great agony over such a heavy loss of life, and were practically living the life of ascetics.
What did they have to aspire for further in their life?
Even materially speaking.
Of course, from a spiritual perspective, success in this life, whatever we may do, is if we become Krishna conscious,
and put our body in Krishna consciousness but for materialists they make calculations I will live my
life in such a way that I enjoy my the prime of my youth and when I become old then my family
members my descendants will take over and they will enjoy life in this material world power or
wealth or some fame etc all these things but that is never to happen that is never to happen
everyone meets with defeat though everyone means all those who are materialistic they meet with
defeat in every step of their life in this material world because Maya is very very powerful
we are very powerful we are very powerful we are very powerful we are very powerful we are very powerful
are on the clutches of Maya Dhritarashtra was similarly in the clutches of Maya making
calculation oh somehow let me try to kill the fatherless sons of Pandu and once the
pond the five Pandavas are killed then my sons will take over from me I am the caretaker King
but they will take over and become regular King
regular Emperor this was his calculation but all his calculations were completely upset so
Rupa is describing the situation the condition of these two Dhritarashtra and Gandhari their
uncle and aunt of this Tyra and not only they suffered due to the heavy loss of life
in the battle of Kurukshetra but the death news of Bhishma Deva uncle of Dhritarashtra was another
great shock for the king and the queen for both Dhritarashtra and Gandhari it was another great
shock because Bhishma Deva was the well-wisher of everyone in the family therefore they required
solace from Maharaja Yudhishthira so Maharaja Yudhishthira was conscious of
his duty and he at once hurried to the spot with Lord Krishna and satisfied the bereaved
Dhritarashtra with kind words from both himself and the Lord also Krishna and Yudhishthira both
of them they pacified Dhritarashtra and Gandhari both the Lord and his pure devotee they are always
kind to everyone including the suffering souls
who may be rebellious who may be envious who may be not following the principles of Dharma but
still the Lord is always looking upon every living being as his own child a father looks upon his
child same way because Krishna is the supreme father of every living being and Krishna naturally
will have
concern for the rebellious conditioned suffering souls of this world and Dhritarashtra is one of
them like all other suffering souls of this world so Dhritarashtra and Gandhari they were pacified
by Yudhishthira and Krishna now regarding Gandhari there's a particular mention here Gandhari was a
powerful and powerful woman who was a powerful woman who was a powerful woman who was a powerful woman
who was a powerful woman who was an ascetic although she was living the life of a faithful wife and
a kind mother Gandhari she was not like Dhritarashtra materialistic she was very very
very advanced spiritually the pravapada says she was on the level of Bhishma as regards Brahmapurias
spiritual attainment because she was a very faithful wife of her husband
Dhritarashtra it is said that Gandhari also voluntarily closed her eyes because
of the blindness of her husband when she came to know that I am going to get
married to a blind King before her marriage she voluntarily agreed to
remain blind whole life voluntarily her eyesight was perfect but she
voluntarily agreed to close her eyes whole life because of the blindness of
her husband a wife's duty is to follow the husband cent percent and Gandhari
was so true to her husband that she followed him even his perpetual
blindness in the entire life she followed him
you know
therefore interaction she was a great ascetic tapas win increased
Tapaswini described here particularly well described here
besides this austere T here undertaken the shock she suffered because the
wholesale killing of her 100 sons and grandsons also a searchance a whole jam
killing of her 100 sons and grandsons also a searchance a whole jam
same aggressive really to stop iPads beatings to your mother so she couldn't
certainly too much for a woman. They are soft hearted. They are very, very soft in their
heart. So Gandhari was very much aggrieved on the loss of all her sons, all her sons.
But she suffered all this just like an ascetic, tapasvini. That means she tolerated the suffering,
the grief. She tolerated the grief. So Gandhari, although she was a woman, she is no less than
Bhishma Deva in character, perfect character. She did all her duties exactly according to
the scriptural directions. She was a faithful wife. She was a kind mother.
But she knew that her policy was always that Dhritarashtra should not cheat the Pandavas.
She warned Dhritarashtra, her own husband, and she warned her son Duryodhana to not cheat
the Pandavas, to not attempt to usurp the kingdom which rightfully belongs to the Pandavas.
That was Gandhari's policy.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
